text:
<@UKGV272KS> I already received this material at another time, but we were unsuccessful.
Got something more detailed for HS? Or any successful cases?

If the sending domain is approved by Google and the code is there, it should work. I have read of people being approved and it not working - it’s possible Google is controlling it. :woman-shrugging::skin-tone-2: It is “their” thing after all, so they can pick and choose when or if it works. I’ve also read you need to send to a minimum of 25 people, so just testing to 1 email will not work.

They did release a testing tool: <https://developers.google.com/gmail/promotab/preview|https://developers.google.com/gmail/promotab/preview>

I don’t know anything more than that.

Heya,
been digging into the email-template part of HubSpot and I got some questions.

From what I've gathered there is (was?) something called "drag and drop email templates" (img1), but this has been phased out for HubSpot's 'internal drag and drop templates', the correct lingo might be "coded files"(img2)? Is that ca how it is?

Ref. "old": <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/drag-and-drop-templates|yellow box in documentation page>
It's not directly talking about email templates, but the "old email template" follows the same principle; but the new one doesn't really allow dnd_area like the box says it should
